intro: Matricaria indica, commonly known as chamomile, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa, and is widely cultivated for its medicinal and aromatic properties. The plant features daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers, which are used to make tea and other herbal remedies. Its essential oil, extracted from the flowers, contains compounds like bisabolol and chamazulene, known for their anti-inflammatory and calming effects. Matricaria indica thrives in temperate climates and is often grown in gardens or as a medicinal crop.
